headline.main: GE Tries to Woo Investors With 'Digital Industrial' Vision
headline.print_headline: GE Tries to Woo Investors With 'Digital Industrial' Vision

docs.snippet: General Electric is promising to boost its earnings by about 15 percent in each of the next three years and dole out $67 billion to shareholders as CEO Jeffrey Immelt tries to create a sleeker, "digital industrial" company....
docs.lead_paragraph: General Electric is promising to boost its earnings by about 15 percent in each of the next three years and dole out $67 billion to shareholders as CEO Jeffrey Immelt tries to create a sleeker, "digital industrial" company.

docs.lead_paragraph: Defense ministers from the U.S.-led coalition against the Islamic State militant group discussed the possibility of a Syrian ground incursion two weeks ago but they have not made a decision, an aide to Saudi Arabia's defense minister said on Monday.

headline.main: Pakistan Not to Blame for Afghan Troubles, Official Says on U.S. Visit
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Not to Blame for Afghan Troubles, Official Says on U.S. Visit

docs.snippet: Pakistan should not be blamed for carrying out a "duplicitous policy" or for the problems of Afghanistan, a senior Pakistan official said on Monday at the start of talks in the United States....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pakistan should not be blamed for carrying out a "duplicitous policy" or for the problems of Afghanistan, a senior Pakistan official said on Monday at the start of talks in the United States.

headline.main: Support for Merkel Rises, but Doubts Over Refugee Policy Remain
headline.print_headline: Support for Merkel Rises, but Doubts Over Refugee Policy Remain

docs.snippet: Popular support for German Chancellor Angela Merkel has bounced back after hitting a 4-1/2 year low in February, a poll indicated on Monday, but a majority of voters are still sceptical her government will be able to reduce the refugee influx soon...
docs.lead_paragraph: Popular support for German Chancellor Angela Merkel has bounced back after hitting a 4-1/2 year low in February, a poll indicated on Monday, but a majority of voters are still sceptical her government will be able to reduce the refugee influx soon.

headline.main: Thomas Ends Decade of Self-Imposed Silence at Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Thomas Ends Decade of Self-Imposed Silence at Supreme Court

docs.snippet: Clarence Thomas ended a decade of silence from the bench during Supreme Court arguments on Monday when the conservative justice unexpectedly posed questions during a gun rights case from Maine....
docs.lead_paragraph: Clarence Thomas ended a decade of silence from the bench during Supreme Court arguments on Monday when the conservative justice unexpectedly posed questions during a gun rights case from Maine.
